name: 2_1_mini_example_TextInput
content:
## The following example is a simple starting example on how to use shiny.

## This example provides a text input field for the user. All text entered is
## then returned as a text below the input field.

## Load package
library(shiny)


## Define the user interface (UI)
ui <- fluidPage(
  textInput(inputId = "MyText",
            label = "My text input: "),
  
  textOutput(outputId = "NiceOutput")
)

## Set up back-end logic (server)
server <- function(input, output, session) {
  ## The following would work
  output$NiceOutput <- renderText({
    paste0("You entered the following text: ", input$MyText)
  })
}

## Put both together. You can also click on RStudio's "Run App" button.
shinyApp(ui, server)
